Classes/FastCGIServer.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: allowPortReuse

Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html#/s:9K.abstract: Specifies the maximum number of redirect responses that will be followed (i.e. re-issue the

Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html#/s:9K.name: disableSSLVerification
Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html#/s:9K.abstract: If present, the SSL credentials of the remote server will not be verified.

Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html#/s:9K.name: useHTTP2
Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html#/s:9K.abstract: If present, the client will try to use HTTP/2 protocol for the connection.

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.abstract: The set of HTTP headers to be sent with the request.

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: method
Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.abstract: The HTTP method (i.e. GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) for the request.

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: userName
Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.abstract: The username to be used if using Basic Auth authentication.

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: password

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: maxRedirects

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: closeConnection

Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html.name: Options
Classes/ClientRequest/Options.html.abstract: Client request options enum. This allows the client to specify certain parameteres such as HTTP headers, HTTP methods, host names, and SSL credentials.

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.name: set(_:)
Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.abstract: Set a single option in the request. URL parameters must be set in init().

Classes/ClientRequest.html#/s:9KituraNet.abstract: Send the request to the remote server.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: count
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Get the number of bytes stored in the BufferList.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: init()
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Creates a BufferList instance to store bytes to be written.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: fill(array:)
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Fill an array with data from the buffer. The data is copied from the BufferList to array.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: fill(buffer:length:)
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Fill memory with data from a BufferList. The data is copied from the BufferList to buffer.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: fill(data:)
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Fill a Data structure with data from the buffer.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: fill(data:)
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Fill a NSMutableData with data from the buffer.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: reset()
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Reset the buffer to the beginning position and the buffer length to zero.

Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.name: rewind()
Classes/BufferList.html#/s:9KituraNet10B.abstract: Sets the buffer back to the beginning position. The next BufferList.fill() will take data from the beginning of the buffer.

Classes/BufferList.html.name: BufferList
Classes/BufferList.html.abstract: This class provides an implementation of a buffer that can be added to and taken from in chunks. Data is always added to the end of the buffer (using BufferList.append(...) and taken out of the buffer (using BufferList.fill(...)) from the beginning towards the end. The location indicating where the next chunk of data will be taken from is maintained, this location can then be reset to enable data to be taken out of the buffer from the beginning again.

Classes/ClientRequest.html.name: ClientRequest
Classes/ClientRequest.html.abstract: This class provides a set of low level APIs for issuing HTTP requests to another server. A new instance of the request can be created, along with options if the user would like to specify certain parameters such as HTTP headers, HTTP methods, host names, and SSL credentials. Data and String objects can be added to a ClientRequest too, and URLs can be parsed.

Classes/ClientResponse.html.name: ClientResponse
Classes/ClientResponse.html.abstract: This class describes the response sent by the remote server to an HTTP request sent using the ClientRequest class. Data or Strings can be read in, and URLs can be parsed.

Classes/FastCGI.html.name: FastCGI
Classes/FastCGI.html.abstract: The “root” class for the FastCGI server implementation. A FastCGIServer instance can be created.

Classes/FastCGIServer.html.name: FastCGIServer
Classes/FastCGIServer.html.abstract: A server that listens for incoming HTTP requests that are sent using the FastCGI protocol. This can be used to create a new FastCGIServer and have it listen for conenctions and handle a new client FastCGI request.

Classes/FastCGIServerRequest.html.name: FastCGIServerRequest
Classes/FastCGIServerRequest.html.abstract: The FastCGIServerRequest class implements the ServerRequest protocol for incoming HTTP requests that come in over a FastCGI connection. This can be used to read data from the body of the request and process the original request URI.

Classes/FastCGIServerResponse.html.name: FastCGIServerResponse
Classes/FastCGIServerResponse.html.abstract: The FastCGIServerRequest class implements the ServerResponse protocol for incoming HTTP requests that come in over a FastCGI connection.

Classes/HTTP.html.name: HTTP
Classes/HTTP.html.abstract: A set of helpers for HTTP: status codes mapping, server and client request creation.

Classes/HTTPServer.html.name: HTTPServer
Classes/HTTPServer.html.abstract: An HTTP server that listens for connections on a socket.

Classes/HTTPServerRequest.html.name: HTTPServerRequest
Classes/HTTPServerRequest.html.abstract: This class implements the ServerRequest protocol for incoming sockets that are communicating via the HTTP protocol. Data and Strings can be read in.

Classes/HTTPServerResponse.html.name: HTTPServerResponse
Classes/HTTPServerResponse.html.abstract: This class implements the ServerResponse protocol for outgoing server

Classes/IncomingHTTPSocketProcessor.html.name: IncomingHTTPSocketProcessor
Classes/IncomingHTTPSocketProcessor.html.abstract: This class processes the data sent by the client after the data was read. The data is parsed, filling in a HTTPServerRequest object. When the parsing is complete, the ServerDelegate is invoked.

Classes/URLParser.html.name: URLParser
Classes/URLParser.html.abstract: Splits and parses URLs into components - scheme, host, port, path, query string etc. according to the following format:

Classes/HeadersContainer.html.name: HeadersContainer
Classes/HeadersContainer.html.abstract: A class that abstracts out the HTTP header APIs of the ServerRequest and

Classes/IncomingSocketHandler.html.name: IncomingSocketHandler
Classes/IncomingSocketHandler.html.abstract: This class handles incoming sockets to the HTTPServer. The data sent by the client

Classes/IncomingSocketManager.html.name: IncomingSocketManager
Classes/IncomingSocketManager.html.abstract: The IncomingSocketManager class is in charge of managing all of the incoming sockets.

Classes/ListenerGroup.html.name: ListenerGroup
Classes/ListenerGroup.html.abstract: A class that provides a set of helper functions that enables a caller to wait for a group of listener blocks to finish executing.

Classes/SPIUtils.html.name: SPIUtils
Classes/SPIUtils.html.abstract: A set of utility functions. Includes formatting the given time and date for use in HTTP, where the default value is the current time.
